defenation: An Islamic term with several meanings including arbitration, judgment, authority, or God’s will.
People of the way. the term “Ahl al Sunna” refers to Muslims who follow the way of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his Companions.
The end of life/living organism.
source: "Every being shall taste death, then it is to Us that you shall be sent back" 29:57.

defenation: The time when a person dies. Appointed decree of Allah to cause a person to die.
All praise be to Allah. Phrase used to express the exalted state of Allah.
source: “All praise is for Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And praise be to Him in the Hereafter. He is the All-Wise, All-Aware” 34:1.
The eternal Creator and Master of all that exists or is to exist. “Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “He is Allah—One ˹and Indivisible˺” 112:1.

defenation: Living with Meaning and Purpose describes how we can live with greater meaning and purpose by increasing our consciousness of the presence of God in our everyday activities.

To become a Muslim, one needs only to repeat with sincerity this simple creed:
La ilaha il' Allah, Muhammadan Rasoulu Allah
This means, "There is no god but Allah, and Muhammad is the messenger of   Allah."
Lowest place in Hell that is for those who are the most wretched of mankind.
source: “Then We return him to the lowest of the low” 95:5.

defenation: Feel or show sorrow for the death of (someone).
The one who mourns for the loss of his/her loved one or thing.
An Arabic word meaning one who is subordinated as a slave or a servant, and it means also to worship.
To serve Allah by worshipping to Him and Him alone.
source: “Allah created everything for a man and created a man for Himself”.

defenation: A manifestation of Allah's grace and favor towards his creation.

The barrier between the corporeal and ethereal, separation (Barzakh) is portrayed as a place in which, after death, the spirit is separated from the body – freed to contemplate the wrongdoing of its former life.
In Islam, any innovation that has no roots in the traditional practice (Sunnah) of the Muslim community.
In Islam the place of punishment for unbelievers and other evildoers in the afterlife.
source: “And the wicked will be in Hell,” 82:14.

defenation: Punishment given to the people of the fire.
source: “˹They are˺ those who pray, “Our Lord! Keep the punishment of Hell away from us, for its punishment is indeed unrelenting.” 25:65.

defenation: The fire or fires regarded as existing in hell.
source: “And the Hellfire will be displayed to the deviant.” 26:91.

defenation: Those who are tortured in hell in hereafter for misdeeds in this world.
source: “Those who earn evil and are encompassed by their sinfulness are the people of the Fire, and there will they abide;” 2:81

defenation: To turn one’s back to this world to withdraw from society or from certain activities for the purpose of focusing on one’s worship and spiritual development.
To ask or beg for something earnestly or humbly.
source: “When We bestow Our favour upon man, he turns away and waxes proud; but when a misfortune touches him, he is full of supplication.” 41:51.

defenation: To  trust or believe in something very strongly.
source: “Whenever they are told: “Believe as others believe,” they answer: “Shall we believe as the fools have believed?” Indeed it is they who are the fools, but they are not aware of it.” 2:13.

defenation: Creatures that were created before humans with the purpose of following the orders of Allah.
source: “Allah and His angels bless the Prophet. Believers, invoke blessings and peace on him.” 33:56.

defenation: Creatures whose essence is from light. They are in constant worship and prostration of Allah. It is the 3rd pillar of faith in Islam.
A permission or prohibition based on Islamic law (shariah).  It refers, in simple terms, to an edict or ruling by a recognized religious authority on a point of Islamic law.
An Islamic science of the detailed practical rulings of religion.

In Islam, innate nature (fitra is the innate human nature that recognizes the oneness of God (tawhid). It may entail either the state of purity and innocence in which Muslims believe all humans to be born, or the ability to choose or reject God's guidance.
Corpse-washers. The one who takes care of the dead body by washing and cleansing it.

The term unseen and unknown, in reference to God the forces that shape the world. The Quran states that man (mankind) is unable to see God and his attributes. Belief in al-Ghaib is considered an important Muslim characteristic, as it allows for prayer and faith.
In Islamic belief, Unseen and Unknown is that which cannot be seen nor know about which Allah knows alone.
A narration, report, story (sayings, talk), or tradition about what Muhammad (peace be upon him), the Prophet of the Islamic religion, said or did and about what he did not say or do.
Reward for good deeds.
To submit one’s will through act of worship and obedience to Allah.
source: “You alone do we worship, and You alone do we turn for help” 1:5.

defenation: Relating to or coming from God.
source: “(Adhere to the True Faith and) turn to Him, and hold Him in awe, and establish Prayer, and do not be of those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity,” 30:31.

defenation: Pillars of the religion are fundamental practices in Islam, considered to be obligatory acts of worship for all Muslims.
A trust in someone or something.
source: “Belief is belief in Allah, His Angels, His Messengers, the Unseen, belief (in) His books, belief in the day of judgement, and belief in the good and bad of Qadar (Divine decree).” (Hadith on the authory of Umar (may Allah be pleased with him).

In Islamic tradition it is to say “I have faith in Allah and His Angels, His Books and His Messengers, and the Day of Judgement and that all good and evil and fate is from Almighty Allah and it is sure that there will be resurrection after death.”

In Islamic creed, it is to say, “I solemnly believe in Allah with His all Names and personal Attributes, and I also accept all His commandments by reciting them with tongue and believing them with hearing.”

defenation: To become a Muslim, each follower must believe in six Articles of Faith. These six articles of Faith form the foundation of the Islamic belief system.
Anyone who does not believe in Allah, the Qur’an and the Prophet Mohammad.
source: “And clearly tell the unbelievers: "I am most certainly a plain warner,"” (15:89.)

defenation: Another qur'anic name for the Hell.
source: “When it is said to them, “Fear Allah,” pride carries them off to sin. Hell will be their proper place. What an evil place to rest!” 2:206.

defenation: In Islam, it is the final abode of the righteous.
A person who hides or covers up the truth and refuses to submit to Allah (God). Disbeliever is the one who does not submit his will to the Almighty and is said to be punished in the Hereafter.

1. The act of concealing, denying or refusing to accept the truth about Allah.
2. Showing ungratefulness to Allah for His bounties.

source: “Do the disbelievers think they can ˹simply˺ take My servants as lords instead of Me? We have surely prepared Hell as an accommodation for the disbelievers.”

defenation: A term originally meaning Zoroastrians – adherents of the religion of dualism.
A common expression used throughout the Muslim world and non-Muslim Arabs to mean, in its literal sense, that “what God has willed [has happened]”. It is often used to congratulate someone.
Someone who has a sincere belief and faith in Allah and is a righteous person.
source: “Then We saved Our messengers and those who believed. For it is Our duty to save the believers.” 10:103.

defenation: A religious hypocrite, a person who professes to believe in something but actually does not.
source: “O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from remembrance of Allah. And whoever does that - then those are the losers”. (63:9)

defenation: Sacred, pure values that are related to Allah and it has a spiritual greatness.
source: “My people! Enter the holy land which Allah has ordained for you; and do not turn back for then you will turn about losers.” 5:21

defenation: The one who turns back from Islam after being Muslim.
The one who makes partner to Allah. Someone who associates any other thing with Allah in His divinity and Sovereignty.
Commiter of the sin which does not negate the faith of the doer but puts it under danger.
To commit major sins such as adultery and murder without just cause.
On the Day of Judgement, all creatures who have ever lived will be raised from the dead and will face Allah.
To testify to the truthiness of something with one’s heart.
Verbatim word of Allah whose recitation is worship and was delivered through angel Gabriel to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). Eternal unchanging Speech of Allah.
An individual in Islam who is believed to spread God’s message on Earth and to serve as models of ideal human behavior.
source: “Indeed, We have sent to you a messenger as a witness over you, just as We sent a messenger to Pharaoh.” 73:15.

defenation: Appointment of a person to receive and spread the revelation.
source: “And indeed, We sent Noah and Abraham and reserved prophethood and revelation for their descendants. Some of them are ˹rightly˺ guided, while most are rebellious.” 57:26.

defenation: Unity in Mastering and Creating and Sustaining all that exists.
source: “Say: “He is Allah, the One and Unique. Allah, Who is in need of none and of Whom all are in need. He neither begot any nor was He begotten, and none is comparable to Him” Surah al Ikhlas.

defenation: Testimony of faith which is acted out by saying the phrase “No god but Allah and Muhammad (pbuh) is His slave and His messenger.”
To associate other deities with Allah in divinity.
High is Allah. Term meaning “God is perfect” and “Glory be to God.” It is often used when praising God or exclaiming in awe at His attributes, bounties, or creation.
source: “The seven heavens, the earth, and all that is within them give glory to Him. There is nothing but gives glory to Him with His praise, though you do not understand their hymns of praise. He is Most Forbearing, Exceedingly Forgiving.” 17:44.

defenation: Chapter of Qur’an.
source: Imam Shafei’ (may God have mercy on him) said about the chapter of al Asr: “if God had only revealed this surah it would have been sufficient for the guidance of all humankind.”

defenation: Explanatory science of the Qurʾan. Interpretation or commentary of meanings the Qur’an.

It refers to the concept of predestination or fate. It is the belief that Allah (God) has already determined everything that will happen in the world, including the fate of individuals. This includes events such as birth, death, wealth, health, and success or failure.
Term referring to the proclamation of Allah as One, Single, without any partner, associates anything that would have any similarity with Him.
source: “Say: He is Allah, the One and Only”(112:1)

defenation: To testify to the truthiness of something with one’s tongue.
source: “If belief is only by testifying, then there would not be any hypocrites (munafiqs) among the believers.” Imam Abu Hanifa.

defenation: This means the dedication of all acts of the servants to none but Allah, including supplication, asking help, seeking refuge, fear, hope, reliance, awe, vowing, dread and turning in repentance, and all other forms of worship.
To show humility to Allah by admitting the sins that was committed and repenting for them.
One of the five mandatory prayers. As an Islamic day starts at sunset, this prayer is technically the fifth prayer of the day. If counted from midnight, it is the third prayer of the day.
The intimate parts of the human body must be covered by clothing. Exposing the intimate parts is unlawful in Islam.
The call to prayer (adhan) is delivered five times a day by an announcer (muadhan) to remind Muslims to come to mandatory prayer and leave worldly matters behind.
Islamic practice consisting of a period of staying in a mosque for a certain number of days, devoting oneself to worship during these days and staying away from worldly affairs.
Ritual washing of the whole body, as prescribed by Islamic law to be performed in preparation for prayer and special prayer (Friday prayer)
When having full bath performer needs to be sure that whole body parts are touched by water without exception.
It is a special congregational prayer that Muslims perform on the morning of Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha.
The prayer offered by the one who is need or in trial in addition to the five obligatory prayers.
In Islam, it is the period a woman must observe after the death of her husband or after a divorce, during which she may not marry another man.
Iddah, a specified period of time that must elapse before a Muslim widow or divorcee may legitimately remarry.
source: “As for those of you who die and leave widows behind, let them observe a waiting period of four months and ten days…  .”2:234.
pronun: tuː biː ɪn ðə steɪt ʌv ˈweɪtɪŋ
wordeng: To be in the state of waiting

defenation: Imam is a religious leader who often leads congregational prayers in a mosque.
To lead a congregation on prayer, to give sermons, especially on the day of Friday.
The second call to Islamic Prayer, given immediately before prayer begins.
A type of prayer that is offered when one is in lost state or needs guidance and seeks true path through this prayer.

It refers to the act of cleaning oneself after being in the rest room. It is considered an important aspect of personal hygiene and cleanliness in Islam, and is required before performing any acts worship, such as prayer.
It is done to prevent clothes from getting turned into impure.
Performance of the prayer together with the other Muslims in congregation at mosques is a duty required from every male Muslim of sound mind.
source: “Performing prayer in congregation is 27-times better than prayer performed on individual basis” (Reported by Imam Bukhari).

defenation: Praying in congregation (Salat al-Jama'ah) is a communal prayer in Islam that is performed in a group of two or more people, usually led by an Imam.
It is considered to have more social and spiritual benefit than praying by oneself.
It is a ritualized ceremony following a death to honor, memorialize, and celebrate an individual.
The Islamic funeral prayer is a part of the Islamic funeral ritual. The prayer is performed in congregation to seek pardon for the deceased and all dead Muslims.
A prayer that Muslims hold every Friday, after noon instead of the midday prayer.
After sexual intercourse or seminal discharge, individuals enter this state in which they are not allowed to pray or touch to Qur’an do other types of acts of worship.
Time in which offering prayer is not permissible. They are, sunrise, when sun is at peak, and sunset.
Prayer which is acted out in accordance what was prescribed in the books of jurisprudence.
Instead of washing the feet while taking partial ablution, wiping on the foot covering with the wet hand in accordance with its rules is called mash.
It refers to wiping over the socks or other footwear in wudu (ablution) instead of washing the feet directly with water.
A building for Islamic religious activities and worship. Mosques are usually covered buildings, but can be any place where prayers are performed, including outdoor courtyards.
It is a seat raised on six or seven steps that is located against the qibla wall of mosques. It is used by the leader to deliver the sermon.

Someone who calls to pray. He is the one who proclaims the call to prayer on Friday for the public worship and the call to the daily prayer five times a day, at dawn, noon, midafternoon, sunset, and nightfall.
A prayer that is offered when one is on journey (according to some scholars, the distance for this prayer to be offered is that one should be 96 kilometers away from home).
In Islam, additional prayer, or supererogatory prayer, is a type of optional Muslim prayer.
Praying in Islam is one of the five pillars and is mandatory for all adult Muslims. It is a way to establish a connection with Allah and seek His guidance and blessings.
Greeting that is offered at the end of prayer.
The first essential element (pillar) of prayer is the intention.
To act out something that which nullifies or invalidates prayer, such as speaking, laughing out loud, etc.

source: “Abdullah asked the Prophet Muhammad (pbuh) "Which deed is the dearest to Allah?" He replied, “To offer the prayers at their early stated fixed times.” (Sahih al– Bukhari 527).”
“I prefer that everyone who does an act such as prayer, fasting, charity or any type of good action, that an intention should precede the doing of it.” Ahmad ibn Hanbal (r.a)

defenation: That which constitutes the chapters of Qur’an.
source: “We surely sent down to you clear verses that elucidate the Truth, (verses) which only the transgressors reject as false.” 2:99.

defenation: Signs of Allah.
source: “We have made the night and the day two signs, then We made the sign of night marked by darkness and the sign of day bright, so that you may seek grace from your Lord, and that you may know how to number the years and how to compute, and We have expounded everything in detail.” 17:12.

defenation: It is one of the five mandatory prayers. As an Islamic day starts at sunset, the Noon prayer is technically the fourth prayer of the day.

In Islam, purity refers to the state of being spiritually and physically clean. It is an essential part of Islamic worship and daily life. Muslims are required to maintain cleanliness and purity before performing their prayers.
Muslims all over the world turn towards the (qiblah )during their prayers, regardless of their geographic location, and this unifies the global Muslim community in a single direction of worship.

source: "We see you oft turning your face towards the sky; now We are turning you to the direction that will satisfy you. Turn your face towards the Holy Mosque, and wherever you are, turn your faces towards it in Prayer." 2:144.
“Those to whom We have given the Scripture, and who recite it as it ought to be recited, they truly believe in it; and those who disbelieve in it, they are the real losers.” 2:121.

defenation: To recite means to read aloud or utter words, usually from a written or printed text. In the context of Islam, recitation often refers to the reading or chanting of Quranic verses, as well as the recitation of supplications and other Islamic texts.
It refers to the standing position during the prayer.
Cycle of prayer. It consists of a sequence of physical movements, including standing, bowing, prostrating, and sitting.

It is a term that refers to a specific position or bowing in the Muslim prayer. During this position, the person praying bows forward from the waist with their hands resting on their knees and recites “Glory be to God the highest” three times or more.
State that occurs during the ritual prayer. Prayer for forgetful mistakes.

It is usually done in standardized prayers (salah). The position involves kneeling and bowing till one touch the ground with 7 bones (points): the forehead & nose, two hands, two knees and two sets of toes.
source: “The nearest a slave is to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so increase (your) supplications (while in this state).” (Hadith)
"And to Allah prostrate all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, of the live moving creatures and the angels, and they are not proud." (Quran 16:49)

defenation: Sunset prayer is one of the five mandatory Islamic prayer. As an Islamic day starts at sunset, this prayer is technically the first prayer of the day.
A prostration which is performed for Allah, in order to show gratitude to Him for specific blessing.
source: “It is upon us to be grateful for being grateful” (anonymous)

defenation: The night prayer is usually performed after evening prayer (Isha) and before performing morning prayer (Fajr). The night prayer means to give up sleep, which is why this prayer is preferably performed during the last third of the night.
Ablution is a ritual washing or cleansing of certain parts of the body in preparation for prayer or other religious activities.
There are some things that make ablution break (invalid); such as any discharge from private parts and this applies to stool, urine, semen, blood and wind.

source: "When a slave makes ablution and rinses his mouth, his wrong deeds fall from it. As he rinses his nose, his wrong deeds fall from it..." (Related by Malik, an-Nasa'i, Ibn Majah and al-Hakim.)

defenation: Anything impure is contaminated or corrupted. In this state, a person may not offer prayers, do the tawaf, or recite the Qur'an.
Glorifying Allah by praising Him and claiming Him the Greatest. Literal translation of the phrase would be “Allah is greatest”.
These types of prayers are special Muslim prayers involving reading long portions of the Quran, as well as performing many prostrations.
wordeng: Congregation prayer in the month of Ramadhan

defenation: A form of remembrance that involves the glorification of Allah in Islam by saying: “Subhan Allah”.
Termination of prayer with greetings/saying salutation.
To put trust in Allah (God), to have faith.
Substitute ablution/sand ablution This type of ablution is only permissible in certain cases such as when one is ill, or water isn’t available.
Freedom from pride or arrogance: the quality or state of being humble.
Recitation is a term used in Islam to refer to the act of reading, reciting, or chanting the verses of the Qur’an.
Odd number night prayer (Witr) prayer is one of the greatest acts of worship that draw one closer to Allah.
It refers to the completion of reading the entire Qur'an. Muslims consider it a highly meritorious act to complete the recitation of the Qur’an, especially during the month of Ramadan.
One of the five mandatory salah (Islamic prayer). As an Islamic day starts at sunset, this prayer is technically the second prayer of the day.
The sunrise prayer is the voluntary prayer between the obligatory prayers of dawn and midday.
It also refers to the highest form of worship to Allah.

Donation is a religious charity to help those in need. It is only paid when someone is unable to fast during Ramadan due to medical conditions or any other valid reasons such as a prolonged illness and will not be able to make up the fast.
It is a tax levied on non-Muslims living in an Islamic state. It is one of the obligations of non-Muslims living under Islamic rule, in exchange for protection and certain rights.
In Islam, it refers to the minimum amount of wealth that a believer must possess before they are required to pay charity (Zakah).
wordeng: Reaching one’s wealth up to specified quantity

defenation: It refers to the minimum amount of wealth a Muslim must possess in order to be obligated to pay poll tax (one of the five pillars of Islam).
A charitable trust in the name of Allah, usually in perpetuity, and usually for the purposes of establishing the Deen of Islam, teaching useful knowledge, feeding the poor or treating the sick

source: “The Prophet of Allah [pbuh] said: “(translation) O Allah, I seek refuge in You from incapacity, laziness, miserliness, cowardice, old age, the torment of the grave and the trials of life and death.”

defenation: Date fruit is the fruit of the date palm tree.
source: "Save yourself from Hell-fire even by giving half a date-fruit in charity." (Sahih al-Bukhari 1417)

defenation: Before the age of puberty, a person's faults and crimes are not generally considered as irrevocable according to the hadith.
To make something legally or officially void, invalid, or without legal effect. Nullifying something involves cancelling, revoking, or invalidating it.
It usually refers to lying, deception, and dishonesty. These behaviors are strictly forbidden in Islam, and Muslims are expected to always tell the truth and act with integrity.
A poor person is someone who does not enjoy the basic necessities of life.
source: Narrated by Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him): The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: “The one who looks after a widow or a poor person is like a Mujahid (warrior) who fights for Allah's cause, or like him who performs prayers all the night and fasts all the day.” (Sahih Al-Bukhari)

defenation: A religious duty commanded by God. Acting out is in utmost importance. Mandatory actions are necessary and must be carried out in order to follow the commands of Allah and to attain His pleasure.
It is commonly used in Islamic culture and refers to any action, object, or behavior that is permissible, allowed, or lawful under Islamic law.
In Islam, it is a term used to refer to actions, behaviors, or things that are forbidden or prohibited by Allah.

Also known in English as the Muslim calendar, it is a lunar calendar consisting of 12 lunar months in a year of 354 or 355 days. It is used to determine the proper days of Islamic holidays and rituals.

It refers to the act of ending the daily fast during the month of Ramadan, which is one of the Five Pillars of Islam. The fast is broken at sunset with a meal known as iftar, which usually consists of dates, water, and other foods.
Iftar feast is a meal that is consumed by Muslims to break their daily fast during the holy month of Ramadan.

Term referring to the consensus or agreement of the Islamic community on a point of Islamic law. Sunni Muslims regard it as one of the secondary sources of Sharia law, after the Qur’an, and the Sunnah.
It is a period of time, about 10 minutes, before the dawn prayer begins and when people, who have eaten pre-dawn meal and after that one must stop eating and drinking.
Term that is commonly used in Islamic scholarship to refer to technical terms, jargon, or specialized vocabulary that is specific to a particular field or discipline.

source: “The people of Hell and the people of Paradise are not equal. The people of Paradise are the successful.” 59:20.

defenation: Term that refers to one of the thirty parts into which the Quran is divided for the purpose of recitation during the month of Ramadan.
It usually refers to the expiation or atonement that is required to be performed by a person who has committed a serious violation of Islamic law.
It is an important event in the Islamic faith that occurs during the last ten nights of Ramadan, the month of fasting in the Islamic calendar.
source: “Behold, We revealed this (Qur'an) on the Night of Power” 97:1.

defenation: It is the place where the people who were resurrected will come out of their graves and gather on the day of resurrection.
Something that is disliked or offensive, but not necessarily prohibited or sinful.
The needy (Miskeen) may be someone whose level of poverty is more than the poor or less than him.
Performer of independent reasoning. He is the one who is highly knowledgeable about the sciences of the Qur’an, is capable of independent interpretation.
A person who has reached the age of maturity and is considered legally responsible for their actions in the eyes of Islamic law.

It is the allowance given to a traveler to break or shorten their fasting during the month of Ramadan. Instead of fasting from dawn until sunset as is typically done during Ramadan, a traveler may choose to either abstain from fasting entirely or to fast with a reduced duration. This concession is granted to ease the hardship of fasting while traveling.
An Islamic term referring to recommended, favoured or virtuous actions. These actions are those whose ruling in Islamic law falls between neutral (neither encouraged nor discouraged) and compulsory.
Blessings and bounties that Allah has bestowed upon humanity.
To bestow upon, to give as a blessing.
source: “Allah grants wisdom to whoever He wills. And whoever is granted wisdom is certainly blessed with a great privilege. But none will be mindful ˹of this˺ except people of reason.” 2:269.

defenation: An Islamic concept: the intention in one’s heart to do an act for the sake of God (Allah).
source: “It is narrated on the authority of Amir al-Mu'minin (Leader of the Believers),  Umar bin al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him), who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), say:"Actions are according to intentions, and everyone will get what was intended… .”

defenation: Doer of this act is seen as a rejector of Allah's grace and a failure to recognize the gifts that have been given to us.
source: “And He is the one who gave you life; then He causes you to die and then will [again] give you life. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.” 22:66.

defenation: It is encouraged for Muslims to break their fast as soon as the sun has set, and the sunset prayer time has started.
source: “My nation will remain in goodness as long as they hasten to break the fast.” Hadith

defenation: It is a special moment during the month of Ramadan. It is a time for Muslims to come together with family and friends to enjoy a meal after a day of fasting.
The lunar calendar is a calendar system based on the cycles of the Moon's phases.
In Islamic law, breaking an oath is considered a serious offense, and requires expiation or atonement.

Ramadan is the ninth month of the Islamic lunar calendar and is observed by Muslims worldwide as a month of fasting, spiritual reflection, and prayer. During Ramadan, Muslims abstain from food, drink, and other physical needs from dawn until sunset, and focus on personal and spiritual growth and increased devotion.
Term that refers to the sustenance or provision that Allah provides to all living beings.
Term that refers to the excess or abundance of blessings that a person may receive from Allah, beyond their basic needs or expectations.
It refers to the act of abstaining from food, drink, and other physical needs during the daylight hours of the Islamic month of Ramadan, which is the ninth month of the Islamic lunar calendar.
An opportunity to recompense for individuals who deliberately miss or break a fast during Ramadan without a valid reason.
To refrain from food and drink.
Patience is a virtue highly valued and emphasized in the Qur’an and the teachings of Prophet Muhammad.
It refers to the act of giving help to the poor and needy as a gratitude to the blessings of Allah.

source: “Allah sends His blessings (Graces, Honours, Blessings, Mercy) on the Prophet and also His angels (ask Allah to bless and forgive him). O you who believe! Send your prayers on (ask Allah to bless him), and (you should) greet (salute) him with the Islamic way of greeting (salutation i.e. As¬Salâmu 'Alaikum)” (Al-ahzaab 33:56).

defenation: A solar calendar is a calendar that is based on the Earth's revolving around the Sun, and it is typically divided into 12 months, each with a varying number of days.
They are set of principles, rules, and guidelines derived from the teachings of Islam that govern various aspects of personal and communal life.
A jinn (spiritual being) created by Allah (God) who refused to bow down to Adam when was commanded to do so.

source: “Abu Huraira reported: The Messenger of Allah (pbuh), said, “When the month of Ramadan begins, the gates of the heaven are opened, the gates of Hellfire are closed, and the devils are chained.”

defenation: It includes everything he said, did, and approved of.
source: Imam Malik (may Allah be have mercy on him) reported: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, “I have left you with two matters which will never lead you astray, as long as you hold to them: the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of his Prophet.”
wordeng: The way of the Prophet Muhammad pbuh

defenation: It is a form of remembrance and glorification which involves the praising of God in Islam by saying “There is none worthy of worship except Allah”.
Repentance refers to the act of seeking forgiveness from Allah for any sins or transgressions committed and resolving to refrain from such actions in the future.
The action or process of repenting especially for misdeeds or moral shortcomings.
A repentant person is someone who feels sincere remorse for their past sins and transgressions and seeks forgiveness from Allah and tries not to repeat that sin again.
The quality of not being too proud or confident about yourself or your abilities. Propriety in dress, speech, or conduct.
Ta’zir, in the Islamic law, are punishments needed to protect society against chaos and corruption.
Abstinence in Islam refers to the act of refraining from certain behaviors or actions that are considered to be unlawful or harmful according to Islamic teachings.
The time of day when the sky begins to lighten and the sun begins to rise, typically occurring in the early morning hours.
The term can refer to many things, but one of the most significant blessings is the blessing of guidance and faith.
A religious duty: something that Muslims are obliged to do.
Desire can refer to the inclination towards something, either good or bad.
In Islam it can refer to the act of performing worship and religious duties with dedication, sincerity, and a strong sense of commitment.
To invoke Allah in Islam means to call upon or address Allah through prayer, supplication, or other acts of worship.
The term is often said as a statement of humility and submission, acknowledging that although humans may know the answer to something, God knows what is best.
The reward of this dunya (worldly life) is considered to be temporary and finite, while the reward of the hereafter is eternal and infinite.
source: “Surely the Hereafter is much better for you than the present life” 93:4.

defenation: In Islam means to make a prayer or request to Allah (God) for help, forgiveness, or guidance.
It refers to the sacred state that a Muslim must enter before performing the Hajj or Umrah pilgrimage.
The dwelling place of most righteous believers who have excelled in their devotion to Allah and their obedience to His commands.
source: “The people of Hell and the people of Paradise are not equal. The people of Paradise are the successful.” 59:20.

defenation: An evil doer. In Islamic terminology, the word “fasiq” refers to a person who commits sins or violates religious laws and principles.

source: “And publicly proclaim Pilgrimage for all mankind so that they come to you on foot and mounted on lean camels from every distant point”. (22:27)

defenation: That is a penalty that a person has to pay in case they violate any of the rules and regulations of Hajj pilgrimage.
Performing a pilgrimage in Islam refers to a journey to the city of Mecca that is undertaken by Muslims at least once in their lifetime, as long as they are physically and financially able to do so.
The Black Stone is a sacred object in Islam that is located in the southeastern corner of the Ka’ba, which is the most sacred site in Islam, located in the center of the Great Mosque in Mecca.
The act of completely shaving his head by the male pilgrim on the 10th of Dhul-Hijjah.
In many Muslim countries, people who have performed Hajj are given the honorary title of “Hajji”.
It is a type of supplication made at the beginning of an act of worship or ritual, such as before starting the daily prayers or reciting the Qur’an.
That is the act of kissing Hajar al-Aswad or gesturing towards it at the beginning and at the end of each circuit of the Kaaba during the rite of to walk around (tawaf).

A corpse is the body of a dead human. In Islam, there are specific guidelines for the handling and burial of a deceased person. Muslims are encouraged to bury the deceased as soon as possible after death, and it is considered a communal obligation to ensure that the body is properly washed, shrouded, and buried.
A shroud is a cloth that is used to wrap a body for burial or funeral rites.
In Islam, enshrouding refers to the process of wrapping the deceased person's body in a white cloth.
The Ka’ba is a cube-shaped building located in the center of the Grand Mosque in Mecca, Saudi Arabia.
It is embroidered in gold thread with the Shahadah, praises of Allah, and verses of the Qur’an.
wordeng: The black cloth that drapes the Ka’bah

defenation: In Islamic culture, a seer (kahin) refers to a person who claims to have knowledge of the unseen and the ability to predict the future.
It is a term used in Islam to refer to the sin of looking at something or someone with lustful intentions. It is considered a form of adultery and is forbidden in Islam.
It is the term used in Islam to refer to an accepted Hajj.
It refers to a person who joins the congregation of prayer late and finds the imam (prayer leader) already in the second or subsequent unit of the prayer.
Actions in Islam refer to any behavior or action that goes against the teachings and principles of Islam.
That which means last, ultimate, end or close refers to the afterlife or the life that follows the earthly life.
The term refers to the blessings and recompense that a person earns in the afterlife as a result of their good deeds, belief in God, and obedience to His commands in this life.
It generally refers to a person who has been chosen by a divine power to receive and convey a message or revelation to humanity.
In Islam, the concept of grave suffering is related to the punishment that some people may experience in the grave after death, based on their deeds and actions in life.
In Islam, missed prayers refer to the obligatory prayers (Salat) that a person may have missed due to forgetfulness, sleeping through the prayer time, or being in a state of impurity.
It is one of the three types of pilgrimage in Islam. It involves combining Umrah and Hajj without exiting the state of Ihram in between.
It is a mandatory ritual in Hajj and Umrah and it is performed after walk about Ka’ba (tawaf). It refers to walking back and forth between the two hills of Safa and Marwa adjacent to Al-Kaba’a.
In Islam, a Companion  refers to a person who met and saw the Prophet Muhammad (pbuh) at least once during his lifetime and died as a Muslim.
Blessings and compensation that a person receives from Allah for performing good deeds and following the commandments of Islam.
Cutting off the ties of kinship in Islam is a major sin and is strongly condemned.
pronun: kʌt.ɪŋ ɒf ðə taɪs əv  kɪn.ʃɪp
wordeng: To cut off the ties of kinship

defenation: Chant that is sung in unison in the beginning of the pilgrimage until the end of it. The phrase, “Labbayk Allahumma labbayk. Labbayka la shareeka laka labbayk. Inna al-hamda wa ni’mata laka wal mulk. La shareeka lak,” translates to, “I am at Your service. Oh Allah! I am at Your service. I am at Your service. You have no partner, I am at Your service. Surely, all praise and grace are for You, as is dominion over the entire universe. You have no partner.” This is recited to enter the state of Ihram and during multiple rites of the Hajj.
This is one of the three types of pilgrimage in Islam. It involves performing Umrah during the months of pilgrimage (the months of Shawwal, Dhul-Qa’dah, and the first ten days of Dhul-Hijjah).
It is the portion of the Islamic prayer where the person kneels or sits on the ground facing Mecca, glorifying God, and greeting the messenger and the righteous people.
The ritual of circumambulating the Ka’ba seven times as part of the pilgrimage.
The term refers to the state of being grateful to Allah (God) in one's heart and mind.

wordeng: Maintaining 3 days of condolences and conditions of bereavement

defenation: Islamic community is built on the belief in the oneness of God, the prophethood of Muhammad (pbuh), and the practice of the Five Pillars of Islam.
The term has also been used for a 10% tax on merchandise imported from states that taxed the Muslims on their products.
Divine communication of God’s messages to the Prophet Muhammad (pbuh) through the Angel Gabriel [ˈɡeɪbriəl], which was then recorded in the holy scripture of Islam, the Qur’an.
To cancel or nullify something, such as a contract or an action or even an act of worship, rendering it legally or officially void.
Person who is deeply religious and devout.
In prayer, a muslim is adviced to recite one additional chapter from the Qur’an in addition to mandatory surah.
Zamzam water is a well-known and sacred water source located in Mecca, Saudi Arabia.
It is the practice of the remembrance of Allah  through recitation and repetition of certain phrases and prayers.
Fornication, also known as zina, is a major sin in Islam.
Fornication is any sexual relationship between a man and a woman who are not married to each other.
A fornicatior is a person who engages in sexual intercourse with someone who is not their spouse.
The term refers to a visitation made to the graves of the Prophets, companions, or other holy individuals in order to seek blessings, guidance, or to make supplications to Allah.
Shrine is a place that is considered holy because it is associated with a person or event of great significance in Islamic history.
It is an integral part of the prayer. The prayer begins in the standing position and some prayers only require the standing (qiyām), such as funeral prayer (Salat-al Janazah).
The sitting posture during prayer.
The concluding (tasleem) or greeting at the end of the prayer is one of its pillars and one cannot end or exit from the prayer without saying it.
wordeng: The concluding portion of the prayer with greetings

defenation: The phrase which relates the distribution of charity (zakah).
Al-Charimoon is a person in debt, which is clearly stated in the Quran as an eligible category to receive charity(zakah).
Showing off is an act of discharging or offering acts of worship with a deliberate intention of making people see the act so that they can praise.
According to Islam, the bridge which every human who had ever lived must pass on the Day of Resurrection to enter Paradise.
An oral hygiene aid with widespread use among Muslim population, used to purify one’s mouth.

source: Luqman (a.s.) said to his son: ‘O my son, everything has a distinguishing characteristic by which it is recognized and witnessed … the negligent person has three distinguishing characteristics: absent-mindedness, amusement, and forgetfulness.’[al-Khisal, p. 121, no. 113]

defenation: The throne of God in Islamic theology. It is believed to be the largest of all the creations of God.
Protective jealousy is a sign of strong faith in Allah. It is a quality Allah loves, so long as it is for the preservation of the Muslims' honor.
Wishing that a blessing that Allah has bestowed on the envied person be taken away, whether it is a blessing in religion or in the worldly affairs.
"divesting" God of His attributes
They are typically ordered as: pride, greed, lust, envy, gluttony, wrath, and sloth and shirk (association of God with other deities.).
Idol worship is not forgivable, if maintained until death.
source: “One can always repent from any offense, including idolatry, before death comes” (see 4:18 & 40:66).

defenation: It refers to the people of ignorance bad conduct and evil.
source: “Take what is given freely, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant” Surah Al-A'raf (7:199)
“Satan has taken hold of them, causing them to forget the remembrance of Allah. They are the party of Satan. Surely Satan’s party is bound to lose”. Al-Mujadila (58:19)

defenation: True believer(s) or The True Believer may refer to: One who strictly adheres to the tenets of a particular religious doctrine.

source: "Those who intend to divorce their wives shall wait four months (cooling off); if they change their minds and reconcile, then God is Forgiver, Merciful. If they go through with the divorce, then God is Hearer, Knower." [2:226 - 227]

defenation: A set of rules for the correct pronunciation of the letters with all their qualities and applying the various traditional methods of recitation.
A person who recites the Quran with the proper rules of recitation (tajwid).
The concept that Allah knows everything and has already decided everything that will happen.
Two hostile, corrupt forces that will ravage the earth before the end of the world.
Superstition is forbidden in Islam. Some regard seeing certain things as a bad omen – such as seeing an owl or a black cat.
It is an object used by a person performing salat as a barrier between himself and one passing in front of him. The Sutrah’s height must be no less than one forearm's length.
A school (sect) of thought within Islamic jurisprudence.
Tafsir is the Arabic term for Quranic exegesis, which involves providing commentary on the Quranic text in order to elucidate its meaning.

Islamic tradition also holds that Muslims should rely on God alone to keep them safe from sorcery and malicious spirits rather than resorting to talismans, which are charms or amulets bearing symbols or precious stones believed to have magical powers, or other means of protection.
An evil figure in Islamic eschatology who will pretend to be the promised Messiah and later claim to be God, appearing before the Day of Judgment according to the Islamic eschatological narrative.

It is the portion of the Muslim prayer where the person kneels or sits on the ground facing the qibla, glorifies God, and greets the messenger and the righteous people of God followed by the two testimonials.
Keeping away from people and being alone with the self to worship Allah.
source: Abu Othman al-Maghribi said: "Seclusion is to have nothing to say but remembrance of Allah (Dhikr)".

defenation: When traveling over long distances, one may shorten the morning, afternoon prayer and 'evening prayers to 2 units (rakat), a practice known as shortening Prayer (qasr).
In fact, the Qur'an speaks of the fact that success is only achieved when one rely on God and the believer is steadfast and obeys God's commands.
